meanings.definition: A large North American bird with a bald head and mainly brown plumage.
meanings.sent1: Wild turkeys roamed freely in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The farmer raised turkeys on his farm for Thanksgiving.
meanings.sent3: The turkeys strutted proudly around the barnyard.
meanings.sent4: The turkeys huddled together to stay warm in the cold winter.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the majestic turkeys in the field was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is a failure or has been unsuccessful.
meanings.sent1: The project turned out to be a real turkey.
meanings.sent2: He felt like a turkey after missing the winning shot.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show was a real turkey, nobody laughed.
meanings.sent4: Her idea to start a business without a plan was a real turkey.
meanings.sent5: Being late to the meeting was a total turkey move.
